item.description:
Hi Everyone,

OK i am going to go paddling on Mothers Day, if you can't make it see you on some other event.

Sunday: A slight chance of showers after noon. Mostly sunny, with a high near 69. North wind between 7 and 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. (*this is looking a lot better than Saturdays prediction)

Latest Weather View: http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KBDL&state=CT

I am assuming we will be just fine since this is not a very far or long paddle event and the after party location is under a pavilion roof.

I want us to start paddling by 11:15 am so plan ahead.

This location is a good place to get some flat water paddling done with a few interesting views on the way.

Once we reach the island, some can join me and go up and around which will present a bit of up current paddling practice and some can just enjoy the area until we return from around the back.

Getting to the Boat Ramp site:

http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2686&Q=384270

GPS approximate address: 100 Merriman Rd, Windsor CT

Other directions:

Route 75, west on Rainbow Road, left on Merriman Road. Launch is on the left.

Look for the Brown Signs.

_____________________________________________________________

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The POT LUCK After Party Site is at Spring Park

(Very Near the Bradley Airport off of rte 75)

GPS approximate address:# 200 Spring Street, Windsor Locks

The Pot Luck Lunch Barbie-Q is NEARBY at a restful outside location AFTER this Event . 
 
When you Leave the site, take a right onto Merriman Rd, take a Right onto rainbow Rd, take a Left into Hamilton Standard and get onto rte 20, head EAST and get  on to rte 75 NORTH, go apx 1 mile then take a RIGHT onto Spring Street, go apx 1 mile and the Spring Street Park sign will be on your right ..its before the cemetary.

 
Bring your chairs, Pot Luck food, and whatever. I have the grill and fire pit loaded.

 

See you soon.

al-r

KAYAKS need to be reserved prior to me leaving for the PADDLE SITE:

 DOUGHNATION OF $20.00 PER DAY

 (all accessories and transportation included.)

Cheap LIfe Jackets with a whistle is all i have for most of you since a GOOD QUALITY LIFE JACKET is about $140.00 and then it should be chosen for your particular body shapes, paddling style, and fit be adjusted, if you have your own please bring it. 

I only have 3 of those  "GOOD" $100.00-$140.00 life jackets for someone that can fit in them. 
One is a Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me, but i like the way it works. http://www.rei.com/product/751058

& http://www.watersports.co/womens-kayak-life-vests/c1000001793/stohlquist-towmotion-womens-kayak-life-jacket-2010-p219446.html
#### 
All my yaks come with the TOP RATED Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles because they are Hollow and light (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.)
You choose your preference. http://www.wernerpaddles.com/paddles/touring/performance_core/kalliste/
#### Also for comfort is my favourite "Yak Pad's" optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere. http://www.yakpads.com/11-paddle-saddle-with-high-backrest.html
#### BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access: http://www.kayakproshop.com/SL_deckbag.html


 KAYAKS: PLEASE INDICATE WHICH KAYAK YOU FIT IN AND OR CAN HANDLE in your RSVP if you need one of the following Yaks:

  (I CAN SUGGEST WHICH ONE IF NEEDED based on your physical size and skills if you are not sure).


#### NEW TO THE FLEET--->KAYAK A:       Home Depot Cull Wood & Luan Plywood Panel Special 15'  (Don't laugh , this boat is acceptable and actually will get finished over the summer or it will be used for a end of the season campfire).

This Kayak was built using scrap wood of all sorts and is now part of the fleet.

It is moderately stable and moves along quite well, (I have not checked its cruising speed or top speed yet). Im sure i will see someone paddling it to shore pretty fast though.

It has a removable Johnson toilet seat and a YakPadz seat back pad available but i have no foot pegs installed yet. Sponge is included.

---x---      ---RESERVED FOR ALEX ---


#### KAYAK 1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer 18', Red, Rudder Equipped. 

Highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable expedition Sea kayak.
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills. 
http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer 
---AVAILABLE---      --- ---

 

#### KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.  http://www.neckykayaks.com/kayaks/touring/eliza_polymer.shtml 

---AVAILABLE---         --- ---


#### KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (43 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.  http://www.belhavencanoe.com/Necky/Eliza%20Comp/Elizacomp.htm

---AVAILABLE ---        --- ---


 #### KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version (Very Thin Fiberglass and now with reinforced floor), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide. 

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit. http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

---X---         ---RESERVED FOR ANNA ---

 

#### KAYAK #5:        Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks 18'.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (50 lbs). Greenland Paddle available also if desired. Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills. http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

---AVAILABLE---           --- ---

 

#### KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro 18', Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style fast kayak.

Low initial but high secondary stability when on full edge. Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced paddling skills. 
http://www.atlantickayaktours.com/pages/retail/boats/ndk/Greenlander-Pro.shtml

---AVAILABLE---             --- ---
item.how_to_find_us: Look for ORANGE STRIPED TRAFFIC CONE @ parking lot and i will be wearing my Orange Hunting Hat.
item.why: This is a "Going Somewhere" paddle event.

item.name: * KAYAK at Rain Bow Res-River * & Pot Luck after party @ Spring Park Pavillion
